techmeme.title: London-based PQShield, which is developing tools for implementing post-quantum cryptography, raised a $37M Series B, taking its total funding to $57M+ (Maria Deutscher/SiliconANGLE)
NY Governor signs two bills to protect minors, banning "addictive feeds", limiting data collection, limiting social media notifications overnight, and more (Lauren Feiner/The Verge)
Claude 3.5 Sonnet appears to be a tremendous leap for Anthropic and LLMs generally, and shows that AI model makers' performance gains are not slowing down (Carl Franzen/VentureBeat)
Sources: Poolside, co-founded by ex-GitHub CTO Jason Warner to build AI tools to speed up software development, is raising $400M+ at a $2B+ post-money valuation (Ingrid Lunden/TechCrunch)
How some Meta users in the US are turning to small claims court, often successfully, to recover their Facebook or Instagram accounts; some won financial damages (Karissa Bell/Engadget)
